sen.j: けいはんな記念公園（けいはんなきねんこうえん）は、京都府相楽郡精華町にある公園。
sen.e: Keihanna Commemorative Park is located in Seika-cho Town, Soraku-gun County, Kyoto Prefecture
Keihanna Commemorative Park is located in Seika-cho Town, Soraku-gun County, Kyoto Prefecture
Keihanna Commemorative Park is located in Seika-cho Town, Soraku-gun County, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 関西文化学術研究都市（けいはんな学研都市）建設を記念し、また平安京遷都1200年を記念事業の一つとして、平成7年（1995年）4月に開園した。
sen.e: This park opened in April of 1995 commemorating the establishement of Kansai Science City (the Keihanna science city) and also commemorating the 1200th anniversary of the movement of the capital to the Heian-kyo capital.

This park opened in April of 1995 commemorating the establishement of the Kansai Science City (the Keihanna science city) and also commemorating the 1200th anniversary of the movement of the capital to the Heian-kyo capital.

This park opened in April of 1995 commemorating the establishment of the Kansai Science City (the Keihanna science city) and also commemorating the 1200th anniversary of the movement of the capital to the Heian-kyo capital.

sen.j: 「自然との調和」を目指すけいはんな学研都市の理念を象徴しており、所在地も都市のほぼ中心にある。
sen.e: Symbolizing the concept of the Keihanna science city aiming at "harmony with nature", it is located amost in the center of the city as well.
Symbolizing the concept of the Keihanna science city aiming at "harmony with nature," it is located amost in the center of the city as well.
Symbolizing the concept of the Keihanna science city aiming at 'harmony with nature,' it is located almost in the center of the city as well.
sen.cmt: almostスペル訂正しました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 周辺には国立国会図書館関西館や私のしごと館、けいはんなプラザ等の学研都市の主要施設がある。
sen.e: Major facilities of Science City, such as the Kansai-kan branch of the National Diet Library, the Vocational Museum and the Keihanna plaza, are located around there.
Major facilities of Science City, such as the Kansai-kan branch of the National Diet Library, the Vocational Museum and Keihanna plaza, are located around there.
Major facilities of Science City, such as the Kansai-kan branch of the National Diet Library, the Vocational Museum and Keihanna plaza, are located around there.

sen.j: なお正式名称は「京都府立関西文化学術研究都市記念公園」という長いものだが、本項では一般的な愛称である「けいはんな記念公園」で記述する。
sen.e: Its offical name is long, "The Kyoto Prefectural park commemorating the establishment of Kansai Sceinece City," and descriptions here are made using its general nickname of "Keihanna Commemorative Park."

Its offical name is long, "The Kyoto Prefectural Park Commemorating the Establishment of Kansai Science City," and descriptions here are made using the general nickname of "Keihanna Commemorative Park."

Its official name is long, 'The Kyoto Prefectural Park Commemorating the Establishment of Kansai Science City,' and descriptions here are made using the general nickname of 'Keihanna Commemorative Park.'
sen.cmt: officialスペル訂正しました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 平成5年（1993年）7月 着工。
sen.e: July, 1993: The work to construct the park started.
July, 1993: The work to construct the park started.
July, 1993: The work to construct the park started.

sen.j: 平成6年（1994年）9月 主要施設完成。
sen.e: September, 1994: Construction of its major facilities was completed.
September, 1994: Construction of the major facilities was completed.
September, 1994: Construction of the major facilities was completed.

sen.j: 平成7年（1995年）4月 開園。
sen.e: April, 1995: The park opened.
April, 1995: The park opened.
April, 1995: The park opened.

sen.j: けいはんな学研都市は京都府南部にある新都市だが、近畿では珍しく遺跡の少ない地域であったため大規模開発が可能となった。
sen.e: The Keihanna science city has newly been built in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, and such a large-scale development was possible, because unexpectely few historically important sites were located in the area, although the place belongs to the Kinki region.

The Keihanna Science City has been newly built in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, and such a large-scale development was possible, because unexpectedly few historically important sites were located in the area, although the place belongs to the Kinki region.

The Keihanna Science City has been newly built in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, and such a large-scale development was possible, because unexpectedly few historically important sites were located in the area, although the place belongs to the Kinki region.

sen.j: けいはんな記念公園は24.1ヘクタールにもなる広大な公園であり、14.1ヘクタールの自然保全区域と、10.1ヘクタールの交流施設区域とに大きく分けられている。
sen.e: Keihanna Commemorative Park is a vast park occuping 24.1 ha, of which 14.1 ha is the area for preserving nature and 10.1 ha is the area where facilities for various activities participated in by persons visiting the park are located.

Keihanna Commemorative Park is a vast park occupying 24.1 ha, of which 14.1 ha is the area for preserving nature and 10.1 ha is the area where facilities for various activities participated in by persons visiting the park are located.

Keihanna Commemorative Park is a vast park occupying 24.1ha, of which 14.1ha is the area for preserving nature and 10.1ha is the area where facilities for various activities participated in by persons visiting the park are located.

sen.j: 自然保全区域はもともとあった自然林や永谷池を活かし自然を楽しめる区域であり、交流自然区域は人々の交流を目的に「芝生広場」、「谷あい」、「日本庭園（水景園）」等が設置されている。
sen.e: The former nature-preserving area, where natural forests and Nagaya-ike Pond are effectively arranged, is for enjoying nature, and in the nature area of the latter area, "a large lawn area," "a valley" and "a Japanese garden (Suikei-en Garden (a water landscape gargen))" are provided for making the people visiting there mingle with each other.

The former nature-preserve, where natural forests and Nagaya-ike Pond are effectively arranged, is for enjoying nature, and "a large lawn area," "a valley," and "a Japanese garden" (Suikei-en Garden - a water landscape garden) are provided to encourage people visiting there to mingle with each other.

The former nature-preserve, where natural forests and Nagaya-ike Pond are effectively arranged, is for enjoying nature, and 'a large lawn area,' 'a valley,' and 'a Japanese garden' (Suikei-en Garden - a water landscape garden) are provided to encourage people visiting there to mingle with each other.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: また公園のイメージシンボルが「月」であり、水景園は月の新名所となることをめざし、「観月橋」や月を意識させるオブジェの設置されている。
sen.e: Since the image symbol of this park is "the moon,""Kangetsu-kyo Bridge (a bridge from where to enjoy viewing the moon)" and objets d'art making visitors aware of the moon have been constructed to make the park a new prominent moon-viewing spot.

Since the symbolic image of this park is "the moon," "Kangetsu-kyo Bridge" (a bridge from where to enjoy viewing the moon) and objects d'art making visitors aware of the moon have been built to make the park a new prominent moon-viewing spot.

Since the symbolic image of this park is 'the moon,' 'Kangetsu-kyo Bridge' (a bridge from where to enjoy viewing the moon) and objects d'art making visitors aware of the moon have been built to make the park a new prominent moon-viewing spot.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 里山の自然が美しい広大な公園であるが、春は桜、夏は木漏れ日、秋は紅葉、冬の雪景色というように、自然と四季が楽しめ、日本の原風景が体感できるように設計されている。
sen.e: It is a vast park full of the natural beauty of Satoya (the woods located near to the human habitat and tended by human beings), but it is also designed so as to enable people to feel how the original landscape of Japan was, by making them enjoy each of the four seasons, cherry blossoms in the spring, sunlight filtering down through the trees in the usmmer, autumn leaved in the fall and snowscapes in the winter.

It is a vast park full of the natural beauty of Satoya (woods located near human habitats and tended by human beings), but it is also designed so to enable people to feel how the original landscape of Japan used to be, by allowing them to enjoy each of the four seasons, cherry blossoms in the spring, sunlight filtering down through the trees in the summer, autumn leaves in the fall and snowscapes in the winter.

It is a vast park full of the natural beauty of satoyama (woods located near human habitats and tended by human beings), but it is also designed so to enable people to feel how the original landscape of Japan used to be, by allowing them to enjoy each of the four seasons, cherry blossoms in the spring, sunlight filtering down through the trees in the summer, autumn leaves in the fall and snowscapes in the winter.

sen.j: また四季を通じて各種イベントが開催されており、特に行楽シーズンには多くの人が訪れ、近畿の新しい観光スポットとなっている。
sen.e: Various events are held there throughout a year, and with especially many people visiting there in out-door enjoining seasons, it has become a new sightseeing spot in the Kinki region.
With various events held there throughout a year, and many people visiting there to enjoy the seasons, it has become a new sightseeing spot in the Kinki region.
With various events held there throughout a year, and many people visiting there to enjoy the seasons, it has become a new sightseeing spot in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 〒619-0238 京都府相楽郡精華町精華台6丁目1番地
sen.e: 619-0238, 6-1 Seikadai, Seika-cho Town, Soraku-gun Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture
619-0238, 6-1 Seikadai, Seika-cho Town, Soraku-gun Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture
6-1 Seikadai, Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, 619-0238

sen.j: 鉄道
sen.e: By railway
By railway
By railway

sen.j: JR祝園駅、近鉄新祝園駅より奈良交通バス 47系統「学研奈良登美ヶ丘駅行」など（約8分）
sen.e: From Hosono Station of JR or from Shin-Hosono Station of Kintetsu Corporation: Get on, for example, a bus on route 47 of Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd (bound for Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station) (it takes approx. eight minutes)

From Hosono Station of JR or from Shin-Hosono Station of Kintetsu Corporation: Get on a route 47 Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd. bus (bound for Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station) (it takes approx. eight minutes)

From Hosono Station of JR or from Shin-Hosono Station of Kintetsu Corporation: Get on a route 47 Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd. bus (bound for Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station) (it takes approx. eight minutes)

sen.j: 近鉄学研奈良登美ヶ丘駅より 路線バス47系統「祝園駅行」など（約15分）
sen.e: From Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station: Get on, for example, a bus on route 47 (bound for Hosono Station) (it takes approx. 15 minutes)
From Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station: Get on a route 47 bus bound for Hosono Station. It takes approx. 15 minutes.
From Gakken Nara Tomigaoka Station: Get on a route 47 bus bound for Hosono Station (It takes approx. 15 minutes.)

sen.j: 水景園へ来る方 『私のしごと館』下車
sen.e: When visiting Suikei-en Garden, get off at the Vocational Museum" bus stop.
When visiting Suikei-en Gardens, get off at the "Vocational Museum" bus stop.
When visiting Suikei-en Gardens, get off at the "Vocational Museum" bus stop.

sen.j: 芝生広場へ来る方 『けいはんな記念公園』下車
sen.e: When visiting the large lawn area, get off at "Keihanna Commemorative Park."
When visiting the large lawn area, get off at "Keihanna Commemorative Park."
When visiting the large lawn area, get off at "Keihanna Commemorative Park."

sen.j: （かなり広大な公園であるため注意が必要）
sen.e: Be careful, because the park is so vast.
Be careful you don't become lost, because the park is so vast.
Be careful you don't become lost, because the park is so vast.

sen.j: 自動車
sen.e: By car
By car
By car

sen.j: 京奈和自動車道 【精華学研インターチェンジ】を降りて精華大通りを西へ約1km
sen.e: Use of the Keinawa expressway: Exit the expressway at the Seika Gakken interchange and drive on Seika-odori Street for approx. 1 km to the west.
Using the Keinawa expressway: Exit the expressway at the Seika Gakken interchange and drive along Seika-odori Street for approx. 1 km to the west.
Using the Keinawa expressway: Exit the expressway at the "Seika Gakken interchange" and drive along Seika-odori Street for approx. 1km to the west.

sen.j: 国道163号 【乾谷西】交差点を北へ約2km、精華大通りを東へ約300m
sen.e: Use of national road 163: Drive from the "Inuidani-nichi" crossing for approx. 2 km to the north and for 300 m on Seika-odori Street to the east.
Using national road 163: Drive from the "Inuidani-nichi" crossing for approx. 2 km to the north and for 300 m on Seika-odori Street to the east.
Using national road 163: Drive from the "Inuidani-nishi" crossing for approx. 2km to the north and for 300m on Seika-odori Street to the east.

sen.j: 京都府道22号八幡木津線 精華大通りとの交差点を西へ約2.2km
sen.e: Use of Kyoto Prefectural road 22: Drive from the crossing between the Yawata-Kizu road and Seika-odori Street for approx. 2.2 km to the west.
Using Kyoto Prefectural road 22: Drive from the crossing between the Yawata-Kizu road and Seika-odori Street for approx. 2.2 km to the west.
Using Kyoto Prefectural road 22: Drive from the crossing between the Yawata-Kizu road and Seika-odori Street for approx. 2.2km to the west.

sen.e: A parking lot is provided adjacent to U-town Keihanna and Konann
